prompt: Which animal is distinguished by its long helical tusk?
icl_complete: The narwhal is distinguished by its long helical tusk. This unique tusk is actually an elongated tooth, and it can grow up to about 10 feet long. Narwhals are found in Arctic waters and are often referred to as the "unicorns of the sea" because of this singular feature.
